quote.text: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables, and said,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king, which made a marriage for his son,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Again, he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them which are bidden, Behold, I have prepared my dinner: my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready: come unto the marriage.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his merchandise:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And the remnant took his servants, and entreated them spitefully, and slew them.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But when the king heard thereof, he was wroth: and he sent forth his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then saith he to his servants, The wedding is ready, but they which were bidden were not worthy.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all as many as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding was furnished with guests.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? And he was speechless.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast him into outer darkness, there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For many are called, but few are chosen.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might entangle him in his talk.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, neither carest thou for any man: for thou regardest not the person of men.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Tell us therefore, What thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, Why tempt ye me, ye hypocrites?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Shew me the tribute money. And they brought unto him a penny.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he saith unto them, Whose is this image and superscription?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: They say unto him, Caesar's. Then saith he unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's; and unto God the things that are God's.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: When they had heard these words, they marvelled, and left him, and went their way.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: The same day came to him the Sadducees, which say that there is no resurrection, and asked him,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Saying, Master, Moses said, If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now there were with us seven brethren: and the first, when he had married a wife, deceased, and, having no issue, left his wife unto his brother:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Likewise the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And last of all the woman died also.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven? for they all had her.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Ye do err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in heaven.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when the multitude heard this, they were astonished at his doctrine.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, they were gathered together.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then one of them, which was a lawyer, asked him a question, tempting him, and saying,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Master, which is the great commandment in the law?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: This is the first and great commandment.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And the second is like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Saying, What think ye of Christ? whose son is he? They say unto him, The son of David.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: He saith unto them, How then doth David in spirit call him Lord, saying,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: If David then call him Lord, how is he his son?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And no man was able to answer him a word, neither durst any man from that day forth ask him any more questions.
quote.author: Matthew
